title: Skirt, early 20th century
medium:
Medium: raffia palm fiber
Technique: embroidered in buttonhole, stem and pile stitches with withdrawn element work on plain-weave foundation
Label: woven raffia, embroidered in  buttonhole, stem and pile stitches with open work
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Anonymous, Dr. and Mrs. Lewis Balamuth, Mr. and Mrs. Dewitt Clinton Cohen, Gertrude Crownfeld, Valerie Dreyfus, Norvin Hewitt Green, Rodman A. Heeren, Misses Hewitt, Sarah Cooper Hewitt, Florence N. Levy, Mrs. Paul C. Pennoyer, Mrs. Harry T. Peters, Mrs. Bernard Reis, Mrs. William Jay Schieffelin, and Mr. and Mrs. Stephens B. Stanton
description: A woman's ceremonial dance skirt with a center panel of dark purplish-brown with a design of interconnected diamonds with striped and dotted fillings created by buttonhole embroidery and withdrawn element work. A wide border on three sides has dark brown raffia cut-pile embroidery with interlacing patterns. Also on three sides, a heavy wrapped cord attached with a buttonhole variation in orange raffia, creates a form of ruffled edging.
